title: NEDOCS Score for Emergency Department Overcrowding
desc: The National Emergency Department Overcrowding Scale (NEDOCS) estimates severity of overcrowding in emergency departments.

orgreference.text: Weiss SJ, et al. Estimating the Degree of Emergency Department Overcrowding in Academic Medical Centers: Results of the National ED Overcrowding Study (NEDOCS). Acad Emerg Med. 2004 Jan;11(1):38-50.

other_refer.text: Hoot N, Aronsky D. An Early Warning System for Overcrowding in the Emergency Department. AMIA Annual Symposium Proceedings 2006;2006:339-343.

data.evidence: Nomogram:
data.facts:
Score interpretation:

Level

 Score Interpretation

Level 1

 1-20 Not busy

Level 2

 21-60 Busy

Level 3

 61-100 Extremely busy but not overcrowded

Level 4

 101-140 Overcrowded

Level 5

 141-180 Severely overcrowded

Level 6

 181-200 Dangerously overcrowded

inputs.name: totalpts
inputs.tips_en: Include patients doubled up in rooms and hallway beds

inputs.label_en: Patients on ventilators in the ED
inputs.name: vents

inputs.label_en: Number of admits in the ED
inputs.name: admits

inputs.label_en: Waiting time of longest admitted patient
inputs.name: waitingtime_admit

inputs.label_en: Waiting time of longest waiting room patient
inputs.name: waitingtime_wr
inputs.tips_en: Technically “Last roomed patient’s prior wait time”
